name: Tobias Kuhn
content: Tobias Kuhn Welcome to my website. I am a tenured assistant professor at VU University Amsterdam and starting entrepreneur focussing on how we can apply semantic technologies in a user-friendly manner to radically improve the communication of knowledge. More on Orcid, Google Scholar, arXiv, LinkedIn, GitHub, and Mastodon. My Topics and Projects My new venture to build the ecosystem of semantic-born knowledge: Knowledge Pixels Small semantic packages called nanopublications can be published through a decentralized network, based on trusty URIs and the nanopub-java library Nanodash (code) is a web tool to browse and publish nanopublications, based on user-friendly templates Controlled natural languages like ACE allow for formal yet fully intuitive knowledge representation, for example in the form of the semantic wiki AceWiki The FAIR Principles aim to make research data machine-understandable across disciplines, for example in the social sciences through ODISSEI Past projects: FAIR is as FAIR does, Capture Bias, ControCurator, Attempto, MOLTO, ERGO, REWERSE Publications Journal Articles Anna-Lena Lamprecht, Magnus Palmblad, Jon Ison, ..., Tobias Kuhn, ..., Katherine Wolstencroft.
